title: For Sale:  Franchi Spas 15
postcontent:
Up for sale is the jewel of my collection, the Franchi Spas 15. This is the ultimate assault shotgun. If you are seriously considering buying this, you probably already know there are only about 180 of these that made it into the country before the 1989 import ban. 

I am the second owner, it was bought new by a gentleman in (of all places) California right before both the import ban and the first CA assault weapons ban went into effect (talk about being in the right place at the right time...) 

I have taken it to the range one time to test it for proper function, and I believe the previous owner did the same, so it is as close to brand new as you can get without being technically "unfired". I ran two mags of #4 through it, and two mags of slugs (about 24 rounds total.) The gun functions absolutely flawlessly, fires as quickly as you can pull the trigger. No jams, failures or anything like that. The action is as smooth as you would expect from a gun that probably has less than 50 rounds though it since new.

Comes with one mag, as pictured. 

If you are familiar with both the SPAS 12 and 15, you know there is one part which is subject to failure (even if the guns are never fired) which is the shock absorber. The absorbers were originally made of a rubber type material which would break down over time and cause the bolt to slam back into the receiver, which could eventually break the receiver. The newer style are made from a hard plastic or polyurethane material and do not decompose, so they basically last forever. The shock absorber in this gun has been upgraded to the newer one. I checked it both before and after firing the gun and it looked like new both times, so there is nothing to worry about there. 

I am aware there has been some scams going on lately with supposed auctions/sales of  SPAS 15 guns on other sites. This is the real deal. My name is Brandon, call me on the phone at REDACTED, or come by in person to look at the gun. I would prefer to do a private sale to a NV resident for cash, but I would be willing to ship to an FFL in another state if necessary.

This robust and powerful battle rifle is one of the last in a long history of standard issue battle rifles and was replaced by the FAMAS in 1972 but kept in French reserves until the 90's when the lot of them were sold off to private organizations. This rifle has been rearsenaled twice and is in absolutely immaculate condition.  Ammo is fairly hard to come by but is still manufactured and loaded ammo is available for relatively cheap online and brass for reloading is readily available.  Reserves of these rifles have run dry forever and no more can possibly be imported so they are getting very hard to come by and the price of these rifles reflects that and has been steadily going up (check Gunbroker.com) so here's your chance to own a piece of 20th century history which likely served with French forces during the French-Indochina war which was the prelude to the Vietnam war!

title: For Sale/Trade:  Taurus PT92 Stainless
postcontent:
I'm trying to sell my Taurus PT92 so I can buy a CZ75.  The gun has been my bedside gun since I bought it in 2/05/2009, and has not been carried (not exactly a pocket pistol!).  The gun functions flawlessly and has never had issues with any type of ammo.  It probably has about 2000 rounds through it, all indoor range with factory ammo, no reloads.  I've trusted this gun to protect myself and my wife for years now, and I trust it completely.  It has never been sent to Taurus for any repairs or adjustments, but the lifetime warranty still applies to the next owner.  The gun comes with everything pictured, and the items are:

1. Taurus PT92 - I have receipt from BudsGunShop showing I was the original owner in 2009, and that the firearm was brand new at purchase.  
2. Pachmayr Wrap Around Grips - Built in finger grooves on the front, and reinforced with steel to maintain shape.  Grips come with backstrap (also pictured), but I personally thought it made the grip too thick, so I left it off.  The backstrap is included though.
3. Two Factory 17 Round Magazines - Both original with first purchase in 2009.  I'll also include the self defense ammo I have in the mags now, which is 24 rounds of Federal HST, and 7 rounds of Remington Golden Saber.
4. Original Factory Grips - Self Explanatory!
5. High Powered LED Flashlight - I'm unsure of the brand (it was a gift, and I don't have original packaging) but it is an LED light designed for firearms, not airsoft.  
6. Combination Lock Bulldog Metal Case - Combination is changeable, I'll help you change it before you leave with your new firearm!
7. Beretta D Hammer Spring - I had a Beretta D Hammer Spring installed in place of the factory.  This smooths and lightens the double action trigger pull, and smooths the single action pull as well.  Overall the trigger is buttery-smooth, with very little takeup, a crisp break and a smooth, distinct reset.  UPDATE: I DO have the original hammer spring to include as well.
8. Taurus Integral Locking System Key - All Taurus firearms have a patented locking mechanism that uses a small key to completely disable the firearm.  This makes it one of the safest firearms I've ever encountered.  When engaged, you cannot retract the slide, cock the hammer, or pull the trigger.

Overall, I love the firearm and believe a 92 (Beretta or Taurus) is a necessary part of any gun collection.  However, I've had the itch to dive into the CZ market for years now, and will go without a 92 for the time being.
